ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription:
On how many days have you used cannabis during the past 12 months? (If there was no
pattern to your cannabis use, please make your best estimate.)
Notes: On how many days have you used cannabis during the past 12 months? (If there was no pattern to your cannabis use, please make your best estimate.)

ElementDescription: Now please think about your recent cannabis use. On how many days have you used cannabis over the past 3 months (90 days)?
Notes: 0 = No days; 1 = 1 - 2 days (less than one day a month); 2 = 3 - 4 days (an average pattern of one day a month); 3 = 5 - 9 days (an average pattern of 2 - 3 days a month); 4 = 10 - 15 days (an average pattern of one day a week); 5 = 16 - 26 days (an average pattern of 2 days a week); 6 = 27 - 52 days (an average pattern of 3 - 4 days a week); 7 = 53 - 78 days (an average pattern of 5 - 6 days a week); 8 = 79 - 90 days (daily/most days)

ElementDescription: Over the past 12 months: How many times would you use cannabis on a typical day when you were using? (Note: at least one hour between each new "use")
Notes: 1 = Once; 2 = twice; 3 = 3 –4 times; 4 = 5 –6 times; 5 = 7 –9 times; 6 = 10 or more times

ElementDescription: Over the past 12 months: How often have you used cannabis first thing in the morning?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Once or twice; 2 = Less than monthly; 3 = Monthly; 4 = One day a week; 5 = Several days a week; 6 = Daily/always

ElementDescription: Over the past 12 months: How much of the average day do you spend/or feel stoned?
Notes: 0 = 0 hours; 1 = 1 –2 hours; 2 = 3 –4 hours; 3 = 5 –6 hours; 4 = 7 –8 hours; 5 = 9 or more hours

ElementDescription: Over the past 12 months: How difficult do you think you would find it to stop using or go without cannabis altogether?
Notes: 0 = Not at all difficult; 1 = A bit difficult; 2 = Quite difficult; 3 = Very difficult; 4 = Impossible

ElementDescription: Over the past 12 months: What was the longest time you went without using cannabis?
Notes: 1 = 6 months or longer; 2 = 3 –5 months; 3 = 1 –2 months; 4 = 2 –3 weeks; 5 = One week; 6 = 4 –6 days; 7 = 2 –3 days; 8 = One day; 9 = No days at all

ElementDescription: Over the past 12 months: Have you felt that you needed cannabis?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Sometimes; 2 = Quite often; 3 = Very often; 4 = Always/all the time

ElementDescription: Over the past 12 months: Have you been able to stop using cannabis when you wanted to? (Reverse scored)
Notes: 4 = Never/at no time; 3 = Sometimes (not often); 2 = Quite often (half the time); 1 = Very often (usually); 0 = Always/all the time

ElementDescription: Over the past 12 months: Have you found it difficult to get through a day without using cannabis?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Sometimes; 2 = Quite often; 3 = Very often; 4 = Always/all the time

ElementDescription: Over the past 12 months: Did your use of cannabis ever interfere with (get in the way of ) your work at school, your job, or your home life?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Sometimes; 2 = Quite often; 3 = Very often; 4 = Always/all the time

ElementDescription: Over the past 12 months: Have you lacked the energy to get things done in the way you used to?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Sometimes; 2 = Quite often; 3 = Very often; 4 = Always/all the time

ElementDescription: Over the past 12 months: Have you given up things you used to enjoy or were important because of cannabis? (e.g., work, school, sports, hobbies, being with family and friends, etc.)
Notes: 0 = None at all/nothing; 1 = One or two things; 2 = Quite a few things; 3 = Lots of things; 4 = Everything

ElementDescription: Over the past 12 months: Has anything you had planned, or were expected to do, not happened after using cannabis? (e.g., a family outing, chores, taking care of children, homework, an assignment, appointment, job interview, training, attending school or work, etc.)
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Sometimes; 2 = Quite often; 3 = Very often; 4 = Always/all the time

ElementDescription: Over the past 12 months: Have you had problems concentrating and remembering things?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Sometimes; 2 = Quite often; 3 = Very often; 4 = Always/all the time

ElementDescription: Over the past 12 months: Did you ever use cannabis after you had decided not to?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = Sometimes; 2 = Quite often; 3 = Very often; 4 = Always/all the time

ElementDescription: Cannabis Use Problems Identification Test (CUPIT) Total Score - Sum of cupit01 to cupit16 (cupit09 is reverse scored)
Notes: 0 = No use at all; 12-20 = Those at risk of developing cannabis use disorder (CUD) in the following 12 months; 20 or more = Adult or adolescent meets the criteria for current cannabis use disorder (CUD); 82 = The highest score a person can get
